title.narrative: Preventing Lost to Follow Up and Sustaining HIV and TB Treatment Among Migrant Populations in Lesotho

description.narrative: The project aims to demonstrate substantive positive change in Lesotho's current health system by integrating migration into current Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) / Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS), Tuberculosis (TB) and Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) services in order to promote continuity of care (HIV/Aids, antiretroviral anti retro-virus treatment (ART), TB and others) and ensure access to COVID-19 vaccine among Basotho migrants (both cross-border and rural-urban migrants) and mobile populations in migration affected communities in Lesotho. While there is a complex relationship between health outcomes and migration in Lesotho, migrants have not received unique, tailored approach to ensure access to health service, specifically ART and TB treatment and more recently COVID-19 treatment and care. In this project, IOM Lesotho, in collaboration with Ministry of Health, National AIDS Commission (NAC), United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS and other United Nations agencies (including World Health Organization, United Nations Children's Fund, will implement the project with an overall objective to contribute to the health outcomes of Basotho migrants and migration affected communities in Lesotho through enhancing adherence to the HIV/TB treatment and access to COVID-19 vaccine.
